name: substitutive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used or able to be used instead of another thing or person: Almost 80% of the individuals included in the study had been under opiate substitutive treatment. The new treatment is likely to be substitutive of conventional therapy.
More examplesFewer examplesPrivate health insurance does not play a substitutive role, as it only covers the costs of treatment in the private sector. Social media is both complementary and substitutive to the arts.Only a substitutive market would constitute a real alternative to statutory health insurance.
